form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Durbin (for himself and Mr. Kirk) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To require rulemaking by the Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency to address considerations in evaluating the need for public and individual disaster assistance, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fairness in Federal Disaster Declarations Act of 2015.

subsection.text: Not later than 120 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency (in this Act referred to as the Administrator and FEMA, respectively) shall amend the rules of the Administrator under section 206.48 of title 44, Code of Federal Regulations, as in effect on the date of enactment of this Act, in accordance with the provisions of this Act.
The amended rules issued under subsection (a) shall provide for the following:

paragraph.text: Such rules shall provide that, with respect to the evaluation of the need for public assistance—

subparagraph.text: specific weighted valuations shall be assigned to each criterion, as follows—

clause.text: estimated cost of the assistance, 10 percent;
programs of other Federal assistance, 10 percent; and
economic circumstances described in subparagraph (B), 10 percent; and

subparagraph.text: FEMA shall consider the economic circumstances of—

clause.text: the local economy of the affected area, including factors such as the local assessable tax base and local sales tax, the median income as it compares to that of the State, and the poverty rate as it compares to that of the State; and
the economy of the State, including factors such as the unemployment rate of the State, as compared to the national unemployment rate.

paragraph.text: Such rules shall provide that, with respect to the evaluation of the severity, magnitude, and impact of the disaster and the evaluation of the need for assistance to individuals—

subparagraph.text: specific weighted valuations shall be assigned to each criterion, as follows—

clause.text: average amount of individual assistance by State, 5 percent; and
economic considerations described in subparagraph (B), 5 percent; and

subparagraph.text: FEMA shall consider the economic circumstances of the affected area, including factors such as the local assessable tax base and local sales tax, the median income as it compares to that of the State, and the poverty rate as it compares to that of the State.

subsection.text: The amended rules issued under subsection (a) shall apply to any disaster for which a Governor requested a major disaster declaration under the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act (42 U.S.C. 5121 et seq.) and was denied on or after January 1, 2012.
